qas.question: Where was Petersburg located in relation to Ford Stedman?
5000 men represented what fraction of General Lee's army?
On what road did the US Army Sixth Corps shatter the Confederate line?
What general commanded the attack on Fort Stedman?
In what month of 1865 was Richmond judged to be no longer able to be defended?

context: Three years later, as <a4_0>March<a4_0/> 1865 ended, the Confederate capitol became indefensible. On March 25, Confederate General <a3_0>John B. Gordon<a3_0/>'s desperate attack on Fort Stedman <a0_0>east<a0_0/> of Petersburg failed. On April 1, General Philip Sheridan, assigned to interdict the Southside Railroad, met brigades commanded by George Pickett at the Five Forks junction, smashing them, taking thousands of prisoners, and encouraging General Grant to order a general advance. When the Union Sixth Corps broke through Confederate lines on <a2_0>Boydton Plank<a2_0/> Road south of Petersburg, Confederate casualties exceeded 5000, or about a <a1_0>tenth<a1_0/> of Lee's defending army. General Lee then informed Jefferson Davis that he was about to evacuate Richmond.
